member.summary: Represents a Windows control to display a position, with separate numeric text boxes for X, Y and Z. The control inherits a with three numeric text boxes. Set and get the position value using the property. It is possible to acceess individual numeric text boxes for X, Y and Z through the .

member.name: P:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.Forms.PositionControl.ReferenceMatrix
member.summary: Reference matrix in global coordinates. The position in the PositionControl is expressed relative this coordinate system.
member.remarks: This property is relevant only when picking a position from the graphics window. If you for example would like to input a position that is relative to a Part, you should assign the global matrix of the Part to the property. The pick position will be transformed to the coordinate system specified by before it is displayed.

member.name: T:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.Forms.RefCoordSys
member.summary: Represents the reference coordinate system functionality and connects the with the . It keeps a collection of which represents the different reference coordinate systems to choose from.
member.remarks:
It is possible to edit the number of reference coordinate systems and their values, in design time. To do that you first have to add a to your .
Built in reference coordinate systems
The most common reference cordinate systems have their own classes deriving from . Please see the See Also Section below.

member.name: T:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.Forms.ToolControlManager
member.summary:
Manages Tool Controls hosted together with browser Tool Windows.
A Tool Control is a user interface control that is hosted inside a Tool Window. A hosted Tool Control can be displayed inside the browser Tool Window, and can be teared off.
A Tool Control shall not be displayed directly by the client. Tool Controls must inherit . By registering Tool Controls with the manager they can easily be shown in the approperiate host. It will also be possible to tear off the Tool Control. Initailly a Tool Control is shown as a child to its host and is often associated to some selected object in the Station. For example a Tool Control for setting the position of Targets, is associated with the currently selected Target. If another Target is selected the Tool Control will update itself, and from now on apply changes to the newly selected Target. When the Tool Control is teared off from the host, a new instance will be created, that is still associated with the same Target, but will no longer react on selection changed.
member.remarks: For internal ABB use only.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.Forms.ToolControlManager.CreateToolHost(System.String)
member.summary:
Creates a host for a Tool Control. Typically Tool Controls are hosted by the browser Tool Windows. The Tool Window does not host the Tool Control directly, but uses another control as a place holder. This place holder is called the Tool Host Control, and is created by this method. When is called, the Tool Control will automatically be added to the Tool host Control. Each host has an identity which makes it possible to find it using Add the returned control to the collection of the browser Tool Window.
The Tool Control itself will be added to the collection of the Tool Host Control, by the manager when is called.
member.returns: The created host that is used to host Tool Controls.
member.param: A unique string identifier of the tool host. For example "ObjectBrowser" or "ProgramBrowser".

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.Forms.ToolControlManager.FindToolHost(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the Tool Control host with the specified identifier.
member.remarks: Predefined hosts in RobotStudio are "ObjectBrowser", "ElementBrowser" and "ProgramBrowser".
member.param: The identity of the host to find.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.Forms.ToolControlManager.RegisterToolCommand(System.String,System.Windows.Forms.Control)
member.summary: Registers a Command corresponding to a Tool Control, to make it posible to display it in the specified host. When calling , only registered hosts will be considered. If the Tool Control should be able to be displayed in several hosts, it has to registered with each host.
member.param: The identity of the command. (CommandBarControl.Id), to register."
The Tool Host Control for which the command should be registered.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.Forms.ToolControlManager.ShowTool(System.Type,System.String)
member.summary: Creates an instance of the Tool Control specified by its and associated with the specified Command Id. If there is a host visible, that has been registered to host the specified Tool Control, the control will be instantiated and shown. The current Tool Control of the host (if any) will be closed.
member.param: The of the Tool Control to create and show.
The Command Id associated with the Tool Control.
